Patch Set 9:

I've split this up into multiple patchsets to help call out syncing up with sdc-fwrule, mechanical changes, and real changes:

Sync for FWAPI-260: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/1
Rename test file so it gets automatically run: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/1..2
Stop using hasOwnProperty: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/2..3 and https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/7..8
Fixup tests to account for change in output caused by FWAPI-260: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/3..4
Add new tests: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/4..5
Sync for FWAPI-267: https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/840/6..7

The real changes here are the newly added tests.

Change has been successfully merged by Cody Peter Mello
need to update the copyright since this file has changed.
Is there a reason here not to use the hasKey from lib/util/obj?
This is a copy of the sdc-fwrule module that lives in smartos-live, so it needs its own safe version of hasOwnProperty().
Is there something weird with the indentation on this line or is gerrit just displaying it strangely?
No, it's the same as everything else. Seems that Gerrit thinks it's whitespace from before the change, I think?

Maybe I'm missing something, but is there something that ensures that a string doesn't end with '\' so that we don't end up reading past the end of ostr here when cur === (ostr.length - 1) and val === '\'? Or are we assuming that tagUnescape will only be run on trusted data?
I assume that it's only run on data that's already passed through the parser, which checks that an escape sequence has valid characters following it.
